script.name: Liz
script.line: All right, we have a lot to get through today, you guys. Anybody have anything on page one?

script.name: Liz
script.line: I think we need to change this Donald Trump joke... because Donald Trump was eaten by a lion this morning, on the International Space Station.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Anyone listening? Yeah, okay.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Cerie, how about, instead of doing the scripts, why don't you just organize those videotapes?

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Oh, okay.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay, actually, could you go downstairs and get me a chai tea?

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Okay, um... where are my shoes?

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, no, just go. Just go barefoot. Just leave your shoes. Okay.

script.name: Frank
script.line: We got to change this Trump joke.

script.name: PA
script.line: Josh to the set, please, for "Sniper"...

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Mr. Jordan?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: What's up, Ken?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: I got your car washed like you asked, and I got that "Baby On Board" sign you wanted, to help you get tail.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Thanks, Ken. You done good.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: It's my pleasure and my job, sir. Anything you ever need, just ask.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: But I want you to know something.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: You and me... It's not gonna be a one-way street.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: 'Cause I don't believe in one-way streets... not between people and not while I'm driving.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Oh, okay.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: So here's some advice I wish I would have got, when I was your age.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Live every week like it's "Shark Week."

script.name: Liz
script.line: That's Stan there. Happy birthday, Stan.

script.name: Liz
script.line: All right, we're halfway done. Let's take a little break. You guys want to have a one-minute dance party?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Yeah!

script.name: Lutz
script.line: Good idea.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Crank it, Toofer.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Yeah, shake it. Feel the music.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, Mr. Donaghy.

script.name: Jack
script.line: No, please, uh, finish your dance.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, we were just taking a little break, and we all love the music of Chamillionaire.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I see. If you don't mind, I'll just observe from... over here.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You will? Why?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Are you familiar with Six Sigma?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Oh, yeah. It's a special kind of G. I. Joe.

script.name: Jack
script.line: It's Frank, right?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Y-yes, sir.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Yeah.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Frank, Six Sigma is the elite G. E. Executive Training Course. To master just its basic concepts, one must brave a five-day conference at a Sheraton. Six Sigma says that a manager must understand, every aspect of the business he or she oversees.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Which means...

script.name: Jack
script.line: I'll be in here every day, soaking it up.

script.name: Jack
script.line: So, please, return to work and act like I'm not here.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay. Let's get into Toofer's commercial parody. We were trying to think of a funnier cereal name.

script.name: Liz
script.line: The favorite options so far include, Honey Bunches of Sadness, Oat Bung, and Swastikos.

script.name: Toofer
script.line: Uh, Froot Lupus.

script.name: Frank
script.line: No.

script.name: Lutz
script.line: Dingleberries.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Fart Nuggets.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Sorry. That's really great.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay, let's just think for another minute. Um, Frosted Mini-Guns.

script.name: Frank
script.line: No.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Lucky Bastards.

script.name: Jack
script.line: If you don't mind, I think we all really laughed at Fart Nuggets, so could we just move on, please?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Every day, huh?

script.name: Cerie
script.line: You guys want coffee?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Oh, yeah.

script.name: Jack
script.line: So, I was doing some research on comedy, and I came across the cartoon strip "Dilbert.", It's quite good. And I was wondering if we could do that.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Do what?

script.name: Jack
script.line: "Dilbert."

script.name: Cerie
script.line: You guys want coffee?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Oh, yeah.

script.name: Jack
script.line: No, no, no, no, no. You can't say that. Jeb Bush is a friend of mine.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Who should I change it to?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Sean Penn. No, Barbra Streisand.

script.name: Jack
script.line: He guns it. Girl falls into the water.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: You guys want coffee?

script.name: Jack
script.line: So he circled back, looking for her. Remember, it's pitch-black out. The boat hits something... hard... and you hear kind of, "eeeeughh.", And Brokaw says, "Just go. Don't look back.", Now, I'm not a writer, but maybe there's a skit in that.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Hey.

script.name: Liz
script.line: What's up? Good morning.

script.name: Pete
script.line: So, is Donaghy gonna be in the room again today?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Ugh, probably, yeah.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Well, you have to say something to him. You guys are not getting any work done.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Really? You don't think his idea of starting with the catchphrases, and working backwards is panning out?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Nuts to you, McGillicuddy.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Who ordered the wieners?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Beep, beep, ribby, ribby!

script.name: Liz
script.line: Actually, Frank wrote a draft of "Beep, beep, ribby, ribby."

script.name: Pete
script.line: Look, you have to say something to Jack soon, or your writers are gonna revolt.

script.name: Liz
script.line: What do you all not understand? He's our boss.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Me trying to tell Jack what to do, would be like you trying to boss around... which one of your kids is it that you're afraid of?

script.name: Pete
script.line: Kyle. Kyle. So strong.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, come on. That was a jacket. That's it. I got to talk to her about her clothes. She can't dress like that.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Yes, she can. People like the way she dresses.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, come on. It's distracting. It's inappropriate.

script.name: Pete
script.line: You're inappropriate, you jerk, with your big, stupid face!

script.name: Liz
script.line: Come on.

script.name: Pete
script.line: No, Liz. Listen, listen, listen. Look at me. Look how bald I am. Look at my life. Please, just give me this one thing.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Pete, no! Come on! I'm talking to her.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Talk to yourself!

script.name: Tracy
script.line: K, my boy! What's the frequency, Ken? I need you to grab me some lunch.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Absolutely. What can I get for you?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I want nachos.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Yes, sir.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: From Yankee Stadium.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Yes, sir!

script.name: PA
script.line: Jenna to the set, please, for "United Nations Bloopers."

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, hey, Cerie. I kind of need to talk to you about something. Do you have a second?

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Sure.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay. This is gonna sound really weird, but, um... you need to wear a bra.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Oh, no, I... I don't, actually. They kind of just stay up on their own. See?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yeah, okay. What I'm saying is, you need to wear a bra to work, if you want to be taken seriously in this business.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Oh, but I don't actually want to work in television.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Career-wise, I'm just gonna marry rich, and then design handbags.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Here's the thing. The way that you dress, is making some people around the office uncomfortable.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Really? Who?

script.name: Pete
script.line: Not me.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I guess it's mostly me that has the problem with it.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Oh, because you have, like, one of those body-image things?

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, it's not that.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Good, because I was gonna say, you still have a good body.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Well, thank you, but this isn't about me.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Like, how'd you dress before you were married?

script.name: Liz
script.line: I'm not married, Cerie.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Oh, for some reason I thought you had, like, three kids.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Nope. Never married. No kids.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: 'Cause sometimes you have, like, food stains on your shirt and stuff. I just assumed that it was kids.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You know what? Forget I mentioned it. You look great.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Is it my birthday?

script.name: Toofer
script.line: You have to get Donaghy out of the room.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Boy, we, as a group, might not smell great.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Come on, he's stifling us. I feel like I just can't be myself around him.

script.name: Lutz
script.line: Yeah, Tracy's downstairs right now, rehearsing the best thing we've written all week.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Beep, beep, ribby, ribby.

script.name: Liz
script.line: All right.

script.name: Liz
script.line: All right, I'll take care of it.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Thanks, Liz.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hey, Mr. Donaghy.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Sorry I'm late. I was at a luncheon for Ann Coulter's 60th birthday.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, yeah. Listen, it's been really great having you in the room, these last few days...

script.name: Jack
script.line: Oh, it's been great for me, too, being around all this creativity.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I'll tell you, in the beginning, I thought it was gonna be a bit of a chore, honestly, but now... oh, I have an idea for you. Uh, Monkey Senate. We open on the Capitol...

script.name: Liz
script.line: You can't be in here anymore!

script.name: Jack
script.line: What's that?

script.name: Liz
script.line: It's not working.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You're driving everybody crazy, and, okay, you can just fire me now, and I will go back to teaching improv to senior citizens.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Why would I want to fire you? This is fine. Six Sigma values direct and honest communication, between coworkers, so, uh... Thank you, Liz.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, sure.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I'll just head upstairs now.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay, well, thank you for being so understanding.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Absolutely.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Oh, no! I will not let you down, sir.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Go get help, girl.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hey, Jonathan. I left a bunch of messages for Jack, but I haven't heard back. Do you know if he got them?

script.name: Jonathan
script.line: Mr. Donaghy's been very busy.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, well, I just... I really need him to approve this budget.

script.name: Jonathan
script.line: Well, I'm sorry. He's out of the country till the end of the week.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: You want to know another key to success?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: I do, Mr. Jordan.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Dress every day like you gonna get murdered in those clothes.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: You did real good the other day with those nachos, but I need you to do something of a different nature.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Okay, would you agree when I say, that a man's freedom only exists, when he's free to pursue his desires?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Yes, I suppose I would.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Which means when the law conflicts with our desires, then we must operate outside the law.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: You following me?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Otherwise, we would no longer be free.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Now, I got a mission for you.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Hey, Liz. I took your advice. I'm wearing a bra.

script.name: Liz
script.line: That's great, Cerie.

script.name: Jonathan
script.line: Liz, can I speak to you for a second?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Sure. What's going on?

script.name: Jonathan
script.line: Mr. Donaghy is very upset, that you banned him from the writers' room. He wants you to apologize.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Really?!

script.name: Jonathan
script.line: But when you apologize, you have to act like it was your idea. He can't know that I told you.

script.name: Liz
script.line: But he sent you here to tell me to apologize.

script.name: Jonathan
script.line: Exactly. I penciled you in for 3:00. This conversation never happened.

script.name: PA
script.line: Jenna, set yourself, please, for "Who Wants to Eat a Dictionary?"

script.name: Pete
script.line: Where's Kenneth?

script.name: Man
script.line: Who is it?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: It's Kenneth from the NBC page program. I'm here for a pickup from Kyang Dang.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Hello, gentlemen. Oh, thank goodness, air-conditioning. Ooh, what does that tattoo mean? When I get nervous, I ask a lot of questions. Do y'all have a bathroom I could use? Y'all have long fingernails. Now, do y'all rent this space, or do you own it? Hey! That's a funny-looking fish. What is that... like, a grapefruit knife? Do you have a cellphone? What's your plan?

script.name: Pete
script.line: This apology thing is... interesting.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, even when it's something normal, I hate going up to Jack's office. I always feel like I'm entering the Death Star. I expect to see stormtroopers. I'm telling you, if Donaghy does this at me, I will run.

script.name: Pete
script.line: You'll be fine... Captain Needa.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, Captain Needa dies. He dies!

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: ß There's no business like show business ß, ß Like no business I know ß, ß Everything about it is appealing ß, ß Everything the traffic will allow ß, ß Nowhere can you get that special feeling ß, ß Than when you're stealing that extra bow ß

script.name: Jack
script.line: What can I do for you? I'm on a helicopter in 15 minutes.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Uh... well, sir, I just wanted to say, um, I'm sorry if I hurt your feelings the other day, when I asked you to stay out of the writers' room.

script.name: Jack
script.line: That's absurd. Completely unnecessary. I haven't given it a second thought.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay, good, 'cause, you know, the writers, they see you as management.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Please, it's water under the bridge. Stop worrying and just go on back to work.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Right.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Of course, I can understand, how you might think my feelings were hurt. No one wants to hear that people don't like you.

script.name: Liz
script.line: What? No, that... No, that's not at all what I was saying before. I never said that people don't like you. That's not true.

script.name: Jack
script.line: So people do like me?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yes, people like you.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Do you like me?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Of course. I like you, Jack.

script.name: Jack
script.line: You know what I like about you?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Your eyes.

script.name: Jack
script.line: You have those... black... shark's eyes, you know? Very intense.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Thank you.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Anyway...

script.name: Tracy
script.line: You done good, kid. That thing ever goes missing, and gets into the public water system, we don't know each other.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Got it.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I got one little errand for you to run.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Tomorrow's my anniversary, and I almost forgot about it.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: But what did I tell you was the secret, to having a good marriage and keeping it together, Kenneth?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Be a good listener, a giver of gifts, and work that vajayjay.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: That's my boy.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: That's why I want you to go see my jeweler.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Good morning, Liz.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, hi, Mr. Donaghy. How are you?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Fine, thank you.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I remember you mentioning what a big fan you are, of the rapper Chamillionaire.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, 'cause I was dancing with Frank? Oh, yes, yeah. I love Chamillionaire.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Well, it just so happens, that he's performing this weekend at Webster Hall, and I got some V. I. P. tickets and backstage passes.

script.name: Jack
script.line: You could take the writers or a friend, whatever.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Enjoy yourself. You deserve it.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Wow, thank you. That's... that's very thoughtful.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Well, I think that coworkers, should have good personal relationships.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I know we've had some missteps, but we've put all that behind us, and I'd like us to be... friendly.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yeah, absolutely, yes. So do I.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Wow, I just can't believe Chamillionaire tickets, were still available.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Ha, well... See you.

script.name: PA
script.line: Josh to the stage, please, for "Homophobic Gays."

script.name: Pete
script.line: What was that about?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Just talking to my bud Jack Donaghy.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Bud? Really?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yes, he said he wants us to be friends, he gave me Chamillionaire tickets, and he even did this to me.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Wow, well, look, having Jack on your side, can only make life easier. It's good for everybody if he wants to be friends.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I know, but it's so weird. It's like that scene where you see, the back of Darth Vader's head with his helmet off, and you're like, " He's a human being.", I got to get some new DVDs.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Did we just go in a circle?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yeah, I was following you.

script.name: Pete
script.line: I was following you.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, I'm going to wardrobe.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Okay, good walk and talk.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Lee, can I check costumes for the cold open?

script.name: Man
script.line: That looks fierce.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Hey, Liz.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Cerie, seriously. Take that off. And, you, stop encouraging her. You're an enabler.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You need to dress like you have a job, and parents who raised you, in some kind of shame-based American religious tradition.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Here.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: I can make this hot.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Now I get to pick out what I think you'd look good in.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, I'm not really a fashion person.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: You're wearing this.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Come on, no.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: I'm serious... this color would be amazing on you, and you're a size 4, right?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Well, aren't you sweet?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hey, guys. What's up?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Ugh!

script.name: Pete
script.line: Oh, my God!

script.name: Liz
script.line: What...

script.name: Pete
script.line: What are you wearing?!

script.name: Frank
script.line: You're making me gay.

script.name: Liz
script.line: It's a joke, obviously. I'm wearing this as a joke. A bunch of comedy writers don't know a joke, jeez.

script.name: Frank
script.line: I just threw up in my mouth.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I said it's a joke!

script.name: Writer
script.line: Work your "thang."

script.name: Lutz
script.line: I think I'm having a heart attack.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Excellent. Right here. Thank you.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Oh, pizza.

script.name: Liz
script.line: There you go. Thank you, sir.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Can we eat this out on the roof gardens?

script.name: Liz
script.line: I don't even know how to get out there. I don't think people are allowed out there.

script.name: Toofer
script.line: No, I see "Today Show" people eating out there all the time.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Really? Even Ann Curry?

script.name: Jack
script.line: I'll show you the studio in just a minute, but, first, this is where my writers write.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Don't mind the odor.

script.name: Jack
script.line: But, seriously, since Tracy's arrival, the show is up in the key demos, we're driving male viewership, and we're effectively synergizing backward overflow.

script.name: Toofer
script.line: Please, Liz. Let us eat outside.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You know what? I'll ask Jack. He'll let us eat out there, right? He and I have an important friendship.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Hey, they didn't bring any sodas.

script.name: Pete
script.line: I'll call Kenneth. Seriously, where is Kenneth?

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Happy Anniversary, Mrs. Jordan. Excuse me, do y'all just have noodles with butter?

script.name: Jack
script.line: reintegrate that position...

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hey, Jack! Sorry to interrupt.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hey, can we eat our pizza outside? 'Cause those wangs from the "Today Show", eat on the roof garden all the time, you know?

script.name: Liz
script.line: And I thought since me and you are best buds... boink... maybe you could do me a solid, and slip me the key to that thing.

script.name: Liz
script.line: This guy's the best. He got me kick-ass Chamillionaire tickets.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You guys like Chamillionaire?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Anyway, Jack rocks. This guy... A-plus.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Excuse me for a moment.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I'm sorry for what's about to happen right now. Just know that I don't mean it.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Don't mean what?

script.name: Jack
script.line: What group home did you escape from, that you would dare talk to me like some plumber's wife, in front of Ron Gordon and Bob Overmyer?

script.name: Liz
script.line: I don't even know who those guys are.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Oh, really? Your ignorance was obvious when you waddled up to me, with your thin-lipped mouth full of greasy peasant food, and addressed me by my Christian name, in front of the gentlemen from Fairfield.

script.name: Jack
script.line: That's Fairfield, Connecticut, Lemon... G. E. Headquarters.

script.name: Jack
script.line: But how would you know that, with your nigh 40 years of public education, and daytime-television viewing?

script.name: Jack
script.line: If you ever pull a bush-league stunt like that again, I'm gonna have you, writing promos for Arena football so fast, it'll make your inexplicably small head spin.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Oh, snap.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I thought you said we were friends.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I said we were friendly.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Well, I don't like you anymore.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I don't believe you.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Go easy on the pizza.
